example1.intent: Each device runs OSPF protocol. Establish OSPF connections between each device and configure appropriate routing policies to ensure that traffic from Adelaide2 to Adelaide1 is load-balanced between the path (Adelaide2, AliceSprin, Darwin, Adelaide1) and path (Adelaide2, Melbourne2, Melbourne1, Adelaide1).

configurations.Adelaide1:
!
hostname Adelaide1
!
!
interface Fa1/0
 ip address 10.0.0.31 255.255.255.254
 ip ospf cost 1
 description "To Perth1"
 speed auto
 duplex auto
!
interface Fa0/0
 ip address 10.0.0.34 255.255.255.254
 ip ospf cost 1
 description "To Darwin"
 speed auto
 duplex auto
!
interface Fa0/1
 ip address 10.0.0.36 255.255.255.254
 ip ospf cost 1
 description "To Melbourne1"
 speed auto
 duplex auto
!
!
!
!
!
!
!
!
interface lo0
 ip address 128.0.0.0 255.255.255.0
!
!
router ospf 100
 maximum-paths 32
 network 128.0.0.0 0.0.0.255 area 0
 network 10.0.0.30 0.0.0.1 area 0
 network 10.0.0.34 0.0.0.1 area 0
 network 10.0.0.36 0.0.0.1 area 0
!
!

configurations.Adelaide1:
!
hostname Adelaide1
!
!
interface Fa1/1
 ip address 10.0.0.31 255.255.255.254
 description "To Perth1"
 speed auto
 duplex auto
!
interface Fa0/1
 ip address 10.0.0.34 255.255.255.254
 description "To Darwin"
 speed auto
 duplex auto
!
interface Fa0/0
 ip address 10.0.0.36 255.255.255.254
 description "To Adelaide2"
 speed auto
 duplex auto
!
interface Fa1/0
 ip address 10.0.0.38 255.255.255.254
 description "To Melbourne1"
 speed auto
 duplex auto
!
!
ip community-list 2 permit 100:0
!
!
!
route-map RMap_Adelaide1_from_Melbourne1 deny 10
 match community 2
 set local-preference 1
 set community 100:0 additive
route-map RMap_Adelaide1_from_Melbourne1 deny 100
!
!
router bgp 10
 no synchronization
 bgp log-neighbor-changes
 neighbor 10.0.0.37 remote-as 20
 neighbor 10.0.0.37 description "To Adelaide2"
 neighbor 10.0.0.37 advertisement-interval 0
 neighbor 10.0.0.37 soft-reconfiguration inbound
 neighbor 10.0.0.37 send-community
 neighbor 10.0.0.35 remote-as 100
 neighbor 10.0.0.35 description "To Darwin"
 neighbor 10.0.0.35 advertisement-interval 0
 neighbor 10.0.0.35 soft-reconfiguration inbound
 neighbor 10.0.0.35 send-community
 neighbor 10.0.0.39 remote-as 120
 neighbor 10.0.0.39 description "To Melbourne1"
 neighbor 10.0.0.39 advertisement-interval 0
 neighbor 10.0.0.39 soft-reconfiguration inbound
 neighbor 10.0.0.39 send-community
 neighbor 10.0.0.39 route-map RMap_Adelaide1_from_Melbourne1 in
 neighbor 10.0.0.30 remote-as 140
 neighbor 10.0.0.30 description "To Perth1"

example32.intent: All devices utilize the BGP protocol. Form BGP connections among the devices and adjust routing policies accordingly to mandate that packets sent from BARRnetPal to NorthWestN follow the predefined path (BARRnetPal, SanDiegoSu, SEQSUINETR, NCSAUniver, NCARBoulde, NorthWestN).

example54.intent: Each device runs BGP protocol. Establish BGP connections between each device and configure appropriate routing policies to ensure that traffic from Calgary to Vancouver prefers the path (Calgary, Edmonton, Vancouver) over path (Calgary, Saskatoon, Vancouver).
